identificationModule.briefTitle: The Coastal Exposome: a Study of Sea Air Inhalation and Possible Links to Health
identificationModule.officialTitle: The Coastal Exposome: a Study of Sea Air Inhalation and Possible Links to Health

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
The research aims to understand oceans as crucial contributors to human health in coastal environments. Oceans produce marine spray aerosols that contain a mixture of microbiota and natural biological molecules (biogenics). The primary outcome envisioned consists of 2 goals.

1. In this study, our first objective is to determine whether the microbiota and biogenic molecules found in sea air are also found in the nasal swabs of the participants. In this way, we will gain an understanding of which sea air components are inhaled by humans and how this changes over time.
2. Second, we want to get an idea of whether these inhaled sea air components have an effect on certain pathways in the human body. In our in vitro study with cell lines (Asselman, J., et al., Sci Rep-Uk 2019, 9), we already saw effects of sea air exposure on certain pathways in the body. Now the second goal of this study, is to see if we see changes in immunity biomarkers (IL-6, TNF-alpha, IL-10) in vivo in humans. We will do this by taking VAMS blood samples from the participants.

conditions: Cytokines From VAMS Blood Samples, Microbiota and Biogenic Molecules From Nose Swabs

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: three groups: one group that lives at the coast all year round, one group that lives inland all year round and one group that live inland but in the month August lives at the coast (to investigate the change in environment) The participants will not get any treatment, they just have to give samples.

armGroups.label: Studygroup that will move from inland to the coast for one month
armGroups.description: This group normally lives inland and live at the coast in august. We investigate the change to the coast environment

armGroups.label: reference group coast
armGroups.description: This group lives inland the whole year round

armGroups.label: reference group inland
armGroups.description: This group lives inland all year round.

interventions.name: change of environment
interventions.description: The participants will change from inland to coastal environment to see the effect. We will take VAMS blood samples and nose swabs from the participant to measure this effect.
armGroupLabels: Studygroup that will move from inland to the coast for one month

interventions.name: no intervention
interventions.description: reference groups, stay in their coastal or inland environment

primaryOutcomes.measure: nose swabs: respiratory microbiome and biogenics profile
primaryOutcomes.description: DNA from the nose swabs will be analysed for microbiota and biogenics on the swabs will be analysed as well, to get an idea of what molecules and microbiota from the sea air are inhaled.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 4 times during the 8 week study period

primaryOutcomes.description: Cytokines will be measured in blood samples to link the sea air exposure to the human health
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 4 times during the 8 week study period

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* health participants between 18 and 50 years old

Exclusion Criteria:

* people with a medical condition
* people younger than 18 and older than 50
